channel.title: Travel on Gerard McGarry
channel.description: Recent content in Travel on Gerard McGarry

item.title: An Ode To Toronto
item.description: For the past couple of years, an idea has been bubbling at the back of my mind: What if you could live and work somewhere else in the world?

item.title: Romance and heartbreak at Ceoffin Castle
item.description: On the Isle of Lismore, far off the beaten track, is the shambling ruin of Castle Ceoffin. It resembles, more than anything, a gnarled, groping hand reaching skyward.

item.title: Cutting Turf
item.description: Like many working class families, we used to cut turf for our fires in the winter. A visit to an old peat bog brings back some childhood memories…

item.title: Northern Ireland North Coast Photos 2021
item.description: A collection of Instagram shots from drives around the North Coast of Northern Ireland in 2021

item.title: No Filter: 2019 on Instagram
item.description: A round-up of photos from Instagram. From travels to far flung places. And near flung places.

item.title: An unexpected trip to Lourdes
item.description: Last Wednesday I got dragged to France. I’ve never been to France, although I have tried their method of kissing before and even their ticklers once or twice.

item.title: Malta, November 2000
item.description: A photo from back in November 2000, the first big holiday Lisa and I ever took. We stayed near St Julian’s in Malta and one day took this brilliant cruise around the bay, which was just so relaxing.
